title: British Columbia Wildfires Leave Dozens of Buildings Burned
description: The final tally of the damage will be higher, officials said, although no buildings have been destroyed over the past 24 hours as the fires ease.

title: Elections in Ecuador and Guatemala: Four Takeaways
description: Outsiders overperformed, underscoring the volatility of Latin American politics. Candidates calling to emulate El Salvador’s crackdown on crime did not do well.

title: Flight Risk
description: We’re covering near misses on airport runways, severe weather and the Women’s World Cup.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Japan’s Radioactive Water
description: Also, Ukrainian soldiers playing video games.

title: Dueling Tours for Influence as Ukraine War Scrambles Alliances
description: As Volodymyr Zelensky went on a diplomatic blitz of Europe, a top Iranian general made his way to Moscow.

title: Could U.S. Toughness on Chinese Business Have Unintended Consequences?
description: Businesses fear that efforts to look tough on Beijing, which have the potential to be more expansive than moves by the federal government, could have unintended consequences.

title: Luis Rubiales Apologizes for Kissing Jennifer Hermoso After World Cup Win
description: “Probably I made a mistake,” Luis Rubiales, the Spanish soccer federation chief, said after grabbing Jennifer Hermoso and planting a kiss full on her mouth, igniting howls of outrage on social media.

title: Palestinian Man’s Lawyers Say Israeli Police Marked Him With Star of David
description: Photos of Arwa Sheikh Ali’s cheek after his arrest showed wounds including triangular marks and lines. The police denied the accusations and said the shapes had been made by an officer’s shoelaces.

title: Nuclear War Could End the World, but What if It’s All in Our Heads?
description: Some experts want to apply recent neuroscience research to the decision making that could lead to doomsday.

title: Fake Gold on Private Plane Unfurls Mystery in Zambia and Egypt
description: After a plane arrived from Egypt bearing cash, weapons and what looked like gold bars, Zambia arrested 12 people. Egyptian reporters covering the case were briefly detained.

title: Zelensky Thanks Denmark for Pledging to Donate F-16 Fighter Jets
description: The Netherlands and Denmark became the first countries to announce that they would donate the planes.

title: 1973: 35 Israeli Settlements Planned in Arab Area
description: Israel announced further plans to build in territories captured in the 1967 war.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russian Officials Say More Ukrainian Drones Targeted Moscow Region
description: Air defenses intercepted two drones in the area, Russia’s military said. There was no immediate comment from Ukraine, which has been increasingly targeting places deep inside Russia.

title: Radioactive Water Is Complicating Japan and Korea’s New Friendship
description: Japan’s plan to discharge treated water from its destroyed Fukushima nuclear plant has triggered a backlash in the region, especially in highly polarized South Korea.

title: Flight Risk
description: We’re covering near-misses on airport runways, severe weather and the Women’s World Cup.

title: Nurse Lucy Letby Faces Possible Life in Prison for Killing U.K. Newborns
description: Lucy Letby was convicted last week of murdering seven newborns and trying to kill six other babies, making her the most prolific killer of children in modern British history.

title: What One Image Shows About the Darién Gap
description: A man, his daughter, and the many items left behind.

title: Even in War, Ukrainian Soldiers Find Time for World of Tanks Video Game
description: The urge to play a violent video game in the midst of the most brutal land war in Europe since World War II may seem baffling. But it’s a way to cope.

title: Paris Makes ‘Summer Terraces’ a Permanent Part of Cafe Culture
description: The neighbors may complain about the noise, but outdoor spaces that bloomed under a pandemic program are now a permanent and vibrant fixture of city life.

title: Ukraine is building a case of ecocide against Russia as dolphins keep dying in the Black Sea.
There is a crisis of wounded psyches among Ukrainian soldiers.
Caroline Kennedy Visits Solomon Islands Where J.F.K. Survived an Ordeal
description: Ms. Kennedy’s recent swim in the Pacific waters where J.F.K. survived a wartime ordeal shows how her family legacy informs her work.

title: BRICS Debates Adding New Members
description: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa will consider at their summit this week whether to admit more countries to their bloc. China wants to expand it, to challenge the West, but the members’ conflicting interests may get in the way.

title: Saudi Border Guards Kill Hundreds of African Migrants on Border, Report Says
description: A Human Rights Watch report says the guards regularly fire on African migrants trying to enter the kingdom from Yemen and have killed hundreds in a 15-month period.

title: Ecuador Elections Move to Runoff
description: Luisa González and Daniel Noboa were poised to be the top candidates of Sunday’s election in a country where declining security has been the leading issue for most voters.

title: Arévalo Wins Election in Guatemala
description: The landslide victory by the candidate of an upstart party signals an uncertain new chapter in Central America’s largest country.
